TopicTitle: List of places and biomes in KSP (planetary geology & geography) - UPDATING FOR v1.0.x.

Articles.Content: I agree. athmo of Laythe is way higher than 15km. I recenlty aerobrake at laythe. At 10 or 15km, you become a permanent resident of Laythe...

It's looking like no new biomes were added.

I was hoping Duna would get a second look (and I thought we saw previews of this somewhere), but the biome names I'm getting straight from KSP are the same as in 0.90.
Thank you, Random Tank, for checking those values. The forum software didn't warned me of any new posts here, so I didn't update the original post. Now it's done.

Hello.

Just came in to check by, and noticed the picture links in the OP (kerbin biome maps) are dead.

[edit]

Well, all of the links are dead, seems to be a wiki migration issue, might be temporary

[/edit]

This might not be a new biome but I just performed science in a lake on the Grasslands.

The Grassland/splashed experiments gave full value just as any other biome. The science reward slider is set to minimum. Finding science points was difficult and I had no idea that it was even possible.

Does this mean other biomes such as Shores, Desserts, Tundra, Poles and Badlands that have water/lake also contain science points?

Also the Main VAB and Main SPH you have listed as roof but I can obtain those by going close to the main doors.

Edited July 1, 2015 by MoeslyArmlis

Minmus definitely does have multiple biomes. They may produce the same messages, but watch the headers/titles of the experiments: "Surface sample from Minmus Greater Flats", "Surface sample from Minmus Lowlands" etc.

This might not be a new biome but I just performed science in a lake on the Grasslands.

The Grassland/splashed experiments gave full value just as any other biome. The science reward slider is set to minimum. Finding science points was difficult and I had no idea that it was even possible.

Does this mean other biomes such as Shores, Desserts, Tundra, Poles and Badlands that have water/lake also contain science points?

Yes: "[experiment] while splashed down in [biome]" and "[experiment] while landed at [biome]" are two entirely different experiments, with full science points available for each. According to [X] Science (a great mod that provides a checklist of all possible experiments), it's possible to both "splash down" and "land" in allof Kerbin's major biomes---so there's at least one oasis somewhere in the Desert to "splash down" in, and a spit of land in the Water to "land" on. The Field Research Contract Pack includes a number of contracts that give you the positions of some of these harder-to-find locations, with the objective to go there and do experiments.

However, you don't get more science at those hard-to-find places---e.g. it's 5.2 points for observing Mystery Goo anywhere on Kerbin's surface, whether it's landing in Grasslands right next to KSC, or splashing down in a mysteriously-unfrozen lake in the Tundra. So it may not be worth the effort to hunt down both versions (except perhaps for easy ones like Shores).

There are several biomes on Kerbin, and if you go to orbit, you've got low orbit, high orbit and maybe more, I can't remember.
